guide.label: Local knowledge
guide.title: Lake Constance, in brief
guide.subtitle: Get on the water faster: the key patterns, decisions, and caveats in a calm overview.
guide.card1.title: Navigation vs. reality
guide.card1.text: It looks small but behaves like a real inland sea: local wind shifts, short waves, and busy traffic. Plan with margin and keep alternatives in mind.
guide.card2.title: Anchoring is not the default
guide.card2.text: Many areas are sensitive or restricted. A good spot is not just depth: think shelter, seabed, distance, and whether overnighting is practical and allowed.
guide.card3.title: Borders and jurisdictions
guide.card3.text: DE, CH, and AT meet on the lake. Rules, radio, marina regulations, and fees can differ. When it matters, verify via official sources.
guide.how.title: How to use this site
guide.how.p1: Start with the map for distances and alternatives. Then filter the lists by country and draft. Open any entry to see details, notes, and sources when available.
guide.how.p2: The goal is not completeness at all costs, but a calm and useful starting point. If something is missing or wrong, report it via GitHub.

faq.disclaimer.title: Data and responsibility
faq.disclaimer.text: This site does not replace official charts, marina rules, or safety information. It is a curated overview for planning and inspiration. Responsibility stays with the skipper.
